hints.title: Scutoid Plaquettes as Gauge Holonomy
hints.content:
2231: :label: prop-scutoid-gauge-holonomy
2232: 
2233: In the gauge theory formulation (Chapter 12), the **gauge holonomy** around a closed loop $\mathcal{L}$ is:
2234: 
2235: $$
2236: U(\mathcal{L}) = \mathcal{P} \exp\left( -\oint_{\mathcal{L}} A_\mu dx^\mu \right)
2237: $$
2238: 
2239: where $A_\mu$ is the gauge connection and $\mathcal{P}$ denotes path-ordering. For scutoid plaquettes $\Pi_{i,k}$, the gauge holonomy reduces to:
2240: 
2241: $$
2242: U(\Pi_{i,k}) = \exp\left( -R^a_{ bcd} T^c T^d A_{\Pi_{i,k}} \right)
2243: $$

hints.label: def-cst-scutoid-correspondence
hints.title: CST-Scutoid Correspondence
hints.content:
2275: :label: def-cst-scutoid-correspondence
2276: 
2277: For the Causal Spacetime Tree (CST) from Chapter 13:
2278: 
2279: 1. **CST nodes** correspond to **scutoid vertices**: Parent nodes at time $t$ and child nodes at time $t + \Delta t$
2280: 2. **CST edges** correspond to **scutoid geodesic rulings**: Parent-child relationships are geodesics in the scutoid structure
2281: 3. **CST branching events** correspond to **mid-level vertices**: Cloning events create scutoid complexity
